abstract: A button that switches between its normal and alternate content on each click.
overview:
## Discussion

When the value of [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSButton/state] is [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSControl/StateValue/off], the button displays its normal content, such as its [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSButton/image] or [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSButton/title]. When [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSButton/state] has any other value, the button displays its alternate content, such as its [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSButtonCell/alternateImage] or [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSButton/alternateTitle] instead. If the button has no alternate content to display, it may instead draw its normal content using an illuminated effect.

This type of button is best for controlling a Boolean state within your application, while also providing a visual indication of that state.

This option corresponds to the Toggle type in Interface Builder’s Attributes Inspector.

# NSButton.ButtonType.toggle

**Case**

A button that switches between its normal and alternate content on each click.

## Declaration

```swift
case toggle
```

## Discussion

When the value of [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSButton/state] is [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSControl/StateValue/off], the button displays its normal content, such as its [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSButton/image] or [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSButton/title]. When [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSButton/state] has any other value, the button displays its alternate content, such as its [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSButtonCell/alternateImage] or [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSButton/alternateTitle] instead. If the button has no alternate content to display, it may instead draw its normal content using an illuminated effect.

This type of button is best for controlling a Boolean state within your application, while also providing a visual indication of that state.

This option corresponds to the Toggle type in Interface Builder’s Attributes Inspector.

## Configuring Button Behavior

- **NSButton.ButtonType.momentaryPushIn**: A button that illuminates when the user clicks it.
- **NSButton.ButtonType.momentaryLight**: A button that displays a highlight when the user clicks it and returns to its normal state when the user releases it.
- **NSButton.ButtonType.momentaryChange**: A button that displays its alternate content when clicked and returns to its normal content when the user releases it.
- **NSButton.ButtonType.pushOnPushOff**: A button that switches between on and off states with each click.
- **NSButton.ButtonType.onOff**: A button that switches between a normal and emphasized bezel on each click.
- **NSButton.ButtonType.switch**: A standard checkbox button.
- **NSButton.ButtonType.radio**: A button that displays a single selected value from group of possible choices.
- **NSButton.ButtonType.accelerator**: A button that sends repeating actions as pressure changes occur.
- **NSButton.ButtonType.multiLevelAccelerator**: A button that allows for a configurable number of stepped pressure levels and provides tactile feedback as the user reaches each step.
